Route administration
Administration of business process routes includes a set of actions to maintain the correct operation of current business processes with the possibility of changing and adjusting them.
Business process route administration is available when
"View route objects"
and
"Route administration"
permissions are present.
Route administration involves working with the following functions:
process rollback
;
skipping a stage
;
task regeneration
;
clear all routes
;
business process restart
;
Opening the related object
.
Information about the user who performed a function is recorded in the System and is available in the audit mode ( see
“Audit”
for more details).
Process rollback
The rollback function is designed to return to the specified stage. To roll back the business process, the user needs to go to
viewing the business process map
and click on the
button next to the task name:
Skipping a stage
The function is designed to skip the following stages:
service action
, which failed with an error;
timer
;
signal intermediate catch event
;
summarizing parallel
gateway
;
summarizing inclusive
gateway
.
To skip a stage and resume the business process, the user needs to go to
viewing the business process map
and click on the
button next to the task name:
Task regeneration
The regeneration function is designed to automatically delete a selected task and create a new one.
Task regeneration can be performed in two ways:
when
viewing the business process diagram
by clicking the
button next to the task name:
in the
task registry
using the corresponding action in the
control panel
:
Clear all routes
The function of clearing all routes is intended for deleting all running process instances and all tasks on them. To clear the routes, run the
Clear all routes
command in the route object profile.
Business process restart
Business process restart can be specified using the
continueTrace
function. The business process restart function allows tracing the business process again after an error has occurred.
Opening the related object
The "Open related object" button in the registry control panel is designed for quick navigation to the object related to the selected task.
Depending on the task type, the following will be opened:
route object
- when selecting a
business process task
;
object
the relation
to which is configured - when selecting a
user task
.
